intro: Peucedanum macilentum, commonly known as slender cowparsley, is a biennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
